en: He had forgotten all about the people in cloaks until he passed a group of them next to the bakers. He eyed them angrily as he passed. He didn't know why, but they made him uneasy. This lot were whispering excitedly too, and he couldn't see a single collecting tin. It was on his way back past them, clutching a large doughnut in a bag, that he caught a few words of what they were saying.
zh: 他碰巧在面包房附近又遇到了那群披着斗篷的人，他经过他们身边时，狠狠地瞪了他们一眼。他说不清这是为什么，只是觉得这些⼈让他心里别扭。这些⼈正嘁嘁喳喳，讲得起劲，但他连一只募捐箱也没有看见。当他拎着装在袋里的⼀只大油饼往回走，经过他们身边时，他们的话断断续续飘入他的耳朵：
